channel.title: Poog with Kate Berlant and Jacqueline Novak
channel.description: Wellness is a trillion-dollar industry full of scams and snake oil salesmen but comedians and best friends Kate Berlant and Jacqueline Novak just can’t get enough. Join them as they try products and practices, consult healers and experts, and ask the ultimate question: is it truly wellness they’re after or just the thrill of the chase?

item.title: The Presence of Horses
item.itunes:title: The Presence of Horses
item.description:
Kate’s just seen a gorgeous cousin and Jacqueline can’t leave Italy. Ambition is witnessed. Digestifs are praised. An uplifting restaurant moment is shared. The “best onion rings of your life.” An ocean stone for gua sha. Something pineal. Kate makes a fish and tomato promise. Jacqueline pushed True Blood. The hags discuss riding a horse. Spicy Tuna is on the way. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: You go, Girl!
item.itunes:title: You go, Girl!
item.description:
Kate and Jacqueline are both back on the athletic greens. Kate has planned a trip. Colds really last. Kate nearly bailed on a socially explosive dinner. The word manifest. It’s not sloth. It’s not gluttony. Kate’s getting something serious installed and Jacqueline’s waiting for a good flight deal to come home. How many archetypes in a day? Holidays near. Getting a facial at the dermatologist?

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Buttering the Shoe
item.itunes:title: Buttering the Shoe
item.description:
Kate’s at wedding weekend and wants to bitch about construction noise. Jacqueline has settled into saying ciao and scusa. The remains of going to the ice machine and donning the second mask. Women who once said no to Kate. The crone whore at the wedding. Engage the elders. Kate has a heated exchange at LAX and loves it. The pressure to be enchanted by the child. Marion Parke heels.

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

item.title: Drop a Penny in the Sea
item.itunes:title: Drop a Penny in the Sea
item.description:
Kate’s micro-meltdown was intimacy and JN shook her body so an Italian tailor could identify her size. Primi, Secondi, and an instagram cleanse. It’s enough. Celebrate Tom Cruise now. How deep is the ocean? The hags die together in space, at peace and sharing a glance. The Prestige and Marley and Me. Jacqueline will vouch for nothing. Kate considers laser again. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Thought That Counts
item.itunes:title: The Thought That Counts
item.description:
Still an ocean between them, Kate and Jacqueline surmounting internet and audio issues to succeed in bringing forth an episode of Poog. They investigate the topic of the house gift and thank you notes, and they consider the holidays ahead. Mopeds rush by in Jacqueline’s Italian audio ambiance, while Kate ingests construction fumes. The branding path of Benefit, Clinique, and Lauder in years past is considered with enthusiasm. The department store is a problem. Will the hags be the ones to reinvent?

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: A Monk at Night
item.itunes:title: A Monk at Night
item.description:
Jacqueline loves radical healing and ponders making nighttime huge. Kate considers IV therapy and senses she’ll need snorkeling restoration in the winter. To build a spine back piece by piece, it takes hours. Fall asleep you start again. Jacqueline’s jealous of Kate’s vocal steamer.  Normal marital hate.  Neurons fire and wire and even prune from disuse. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Smile Toward The Sun
item.itunes:title: Smile Toward The Sun
item.description:
A technical failure an ocean between them, the hags must converse without conversing. The art of conversation falls apart when rhythm is removed. And still the hags endure. Transparency at all costs. Jacqueline dines and writes in a tiny romantic attic in Rome. Kates hustles to the theater under the scalding New York Sun. Juilliard is grasped.

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Welcome to Delivery
item.itunes:title: Welcome to Delivery
item.description:
Jacqueline will be in Rome this week and is eager for recs. Kate’s loving NYC and wants a facialist suggestion. They reminisce about a time Kate bailed. Kate is stunned by the miracle of food delivery. Staying at a friend’s or an airbnb is a topic they only just begin to discuss. The scroll and the refresh. It’s been weeks. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

item.title: Depleted Poog
item.itunes:title: Depleted Poog
item.description:
10% fat yogurt. Replacing mascara. The hags are stressed and tired and the product suffers. Kate is uninterested in Jacqueline’s arm. Jacqueline retaliates at end of episode with a reveal. Kate’s back on bottled water. Jacqueline is wildly dehydrated. Being told to let the earth carry you and all of that. Two massages, neither quite right. Spider strategies. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: It Was Never Cake
item.itunes:title: It Was Never Cake
item.description:
The Hags are on an eight hour time difference from each other LA and Scotland. Indecision descends as Kate chooses her birthday treat at Sephora. Negative visualization and Stoicism are experienced via an app. Listeners may note: Jacqueline references her own metaphor from a previous episode, lake full of fish, and Kate does not recall it. Jacqueline wonders what makes a product purple, Kate finds the answer, says it twice, and Jacqueline does not hear her. Mirroring language back to the others. We can handle colorless product. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Talking About a Tortilla
item.itunes:title: Talking About a Tortilla
item.description:
Kate reclines as Jacqueline takes Kate through a depressive swirl. John Lithgow’s Churchill, the question of prosthetics and realism in film. Stella Adler. HBD, Kate. The Lychee Martini @ JAR. That which is overhead at the pool. Tearing the curtains, throwing the laptop. Experimenting with not collapsing. JN's Grub Street breakdown. A warm ceramic lantern. The fear of being misunderstood as some breadless and soulless hag. JN begs for a Peabody with more tears.

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: The Black Dog, Again
item.itunes:title: The Black Dog, Again
item.description:
Depression’s passing through and Jacqueline discusses it at Kate’s request, nearly endorsing a sponsor to a priceless degree. Identity questions stymie her efforts. Lemon drinks continue, pith and all. Kate removed the seeds. JN brings tyrannical skincare opinions to her old pals. It's time to face the home and for KB to face the basement. Let's pull out all the stops and use all the tools. The hags are interested in rock climbing walls. They might get dinner.

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

.

.

item.title: Intention in Math
item.itunes:title: Intention in Math
item.description:
Kate woke up without water. Jacqueline bought brushes at Target. Kate gears up to buy a computer and return a body shimmer. Time and space and weight in books, the internet, and ultimately math. Rose gold plastics. Self-directed hotel workouts. Some boys laugh in the gym. The hags have a mathematical break through. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie.

item.title: Bad Moon
item.itunes:title: Bad Moon
item.description:
Fury and rage have unraveled the hags and changed them permanently. It feels like an ugly Poog. Comfort topics include: hotels, planes, and restaurants. A fresh longing emerges to remineralize and embrace amino acids. Jacqueline visited the Fleur Noir in Palm Springs, ate Sushi in the wind, and got an IV bag of vitamins. Kate finally visited Two Bunch and found the hot spring pools too hot. Going back to coach after a taste of first class. The moon moves into Aquarius during the episode. 

.

.

.

.

.

This episode was edited and engineered by C. Tweedie

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

JN’s back from London for now where she secured an epipen through unsavory and brilliant British means thanks to generous hoteliers. She rages with jealousy to hear Kate’s found a new favorite New York restaurant. Large ice cube shapes and loud wallpaper are rudely investigated for the imagined intentions they reveal. .

.

.

.

.

item.itunes:title: All About Gut Health
item.description:
The hags deliver you a morning Poog. Colonics are the primary concern. Jacqueline had one. Kate wants one. Can they get one together? Early surgery and the romance of dying on the table, any table. Being awake while under anesthesia. The importance of Astral Projection. Pre-biotics, pro-biotics, leaky gut and extinction events. Glyphosate and Round Up causing our cells to forget their identity. Lingering in the the hypnogogic phase for creative gains.
